intro: Catabrosa distans, commonly known as the broadleaf catabrosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Catabrosa distans is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
